intro: Crepis vesicaria, commonly known as the bladdergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that aid in wind dispersal of its seeds. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and roadside environments.
